items.title: Romania summons Russian ambassador over drone breach

items.content: Romanian Foreign Minister Oana Toiu announced on Sunday that the country summoned Russian ambassador Vladimir Lipaev to Bucharest for a meeting later today over a drone intrusion. "We do not expect to...

items.title: Romania summons Russian ambassador after drone breaches country's airspace
items.standfirst: Romania summoned the Russian ambassador to Bucharest on Sunday after a drone was observed breaching the country's airspace on its way to strike targets in Ukraine on Saturday. Poland also scrambled fighter jets last week to shoot down a number of Russian drones that had entered its airspace.
items.content: Romania summoned the Russian ambassador to Bucharest on Sunday after a drone was observed breaching the country's airspace on its way to strike targets in Ukraine on Saturday. Poland also scrambled fighter jets last week to shoot down a number of Russian drones that had entered its airspace.

items.title: Romania becomes second Nato country to report Russian drone in its airspace
items.standfirst: Ukraine's President Zelensky called the incursion "an obvious expansion of the war by Russia".
items.content: Ukraine's President Zelensky called the incursion "an obvious expansion of the war by Russia".

items.title: Russian drone incursion into Poland ‘was Kremlin test on Nato’
items.standfirst: Polish minister says Moscow sought to gauge reaction without starting war as Romania reports new incursionPoland’s foreign minister has said the Russian drone incursion into Polish airspace was an attempt by the Kremlin to test Nato’s reactions by incremental escalations without prompting a full-scale response, as Romania became the second Nato country to report an incursion in a matter of days.Radosław Sikorski confirmed that while the drones that entered Poland last week were capable of carrying ammunition, they were not loaded with explosives. “Interestingly, they were all duds, which suggests to me that Russia tried to test us without starting a war,” Sikorski told the Guardian in Kyiv. Continue reading...
items.content: Polish minister says Moscow sought to gauge reaction without starting war as Romania reports new incursionPoland’s foreign minister has said the Russian drone incursion into Polish airspace was an attempt by the Kremlin to test Nato’s reactions by incremental escalations without prompting a full-scale response, as Romania became the second Nato country to report an incursion in a matter of days.Radosław Sikorski confirmed that while the drones that entered Poland last week were capable of carrying ammunition, they were not loaded with explosives. “Interestingly, they were all duds, which suggests to me that Russia tried to test us without starting a war,” Sikorski told the Guardian in Kyiv. Continue reading...

items.title: Romania says Russian drone incursions pose ‘new challenge’ to Black Sea security
items.standfirst: Country’s defence ministry condemns ‘irresponsible actions’ after drone entered its airspace on SaturdaySee all our Ukraine war coverageRomania has strongly condemned the entry of a Russian drone into its airspace during an attack on neighbouring Ukraine, saying Moscow’s actions pose a “new challenge” to Black Sea security.Poland had already denounced the intrusion of Russian drones into its airspace last week, calling on Moscow to avoid further “provocations”. Polish fighter jets scrambled on Saturday in response to fresh Russian drone strikes just over the border in Ukraine. Continue reading...
items.content: Country’s defence ministry condemns ‘irresponsible actions’ after drone entered its airspace on SaturdaySee all our Ukraine war coverageRomania has strongly condemned the entry of a Russian drone into its airspace during an attack on neighbouring Ukraine, saying Moscow’s actions pose a “new challenge” to Black Sea security.Poland had already denounced the intrusion of Russian drones into its airspace last week, calling on Moscow to avoid further “provocations”. Polish fighter jets scrambled on Saturday in response to fresh Russian drone strikes just over the border in Ukraine. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Romania has said a drone breached its airspace during a Russian attack on neighbouring Ukraine.
items.content: Romania has said a drone breached its airspace during a Russian attack on neighbouring Ukraine.

items.title: U.S. says it will defend 'every inch' of NATO territory after Poland shoots down Russian drones
items.standfirst: The United States vowed Friday to defend “every inch of NATO territory” after a number of suspected Russian drones entered Polish airspace during an attack on Ukraine
items.content: The United States vowed Friday to defend “every inch of NATO territory” after a number of suspected Russian drones entered Polish airspace during an attack on Ukraine

ai_summary: Romania summoned the Russian ambassador after a drone breached its airspace on Saturday.
Poland scrambled fighter jets to shoot down Russian drones that entered its airspace last week.
Ukraine's President Zelensky called the incursion "an obvious expansion of the war by Russia".
A Polish minister said the drone incursion was a test by the Kremlin on NATO's reactions.
The drones that entered Poland were not loaded with explosives, according to a Polish minister.

clusters.title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect not cooperating with authorities, sources say
clusters.neutral_headline: Motive sought in shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk

items.title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect not cooperating with authorities, sources say
items.standfirst: Police are searching for a motive in Wednesday's killing of conservative activist and influencer Charlie Kirk. Authorities say interviews with family and friends of the 22-year-old suspect suggest he could have been radicalized in the dark corners of the internet. Carter Evans is in Spanish Fork, Utah, with the very latest.
items.content: Police are searching for a motive in Wednesday's killing of conservative activist and influencer Charlie Kirk. Authorities say interviews with family and friends of the 22-year-old suspect suggest he could have been radicalized in the dark corners of the internet. Carter Evans is in Spanish Fork, Utah, with the very latest.

items.title: 9/14: Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan
items.standfirst: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," House Speaker Mike Johnson joins to discuss the aftermath of the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Meanwhile, Sens. Chris Coons of Delaware and James Lankford of Oklahoma join to talk about the rise of political extremism in the U.S.
items.content: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," House Speaker Mike Johnson joins to discuss the aftermath of the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Meanwhile, Sens. Chris Coons of Delaware and James Lankford of Oklahoma join to talk about the rise of political extremism in the U.S.

items.title: America now in an era of "violent populism," says University of Chicago professor Robert Pape
items.standfirst: Robert Pape, University of Chicago professor and founding director of the Chicago Project on Security and Threats, told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that he believes the U.S. is in an era of "violent populism," which he says can be defined by the rise in political violence from both the right and the left and increased support for political violence.
items.content: Robert Pape, University of Chicago professor and founding director of the Chicago Project on Security and Threats, told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that he believes the U.S. is in an era of "violent populism," which he says can be defined by the rise in political violence from both the right and the left and increased support for political violence.

items.content: CBS News justice correspondent Scott MacFarlane breaks down what to know as Utah authorities prepare to file charges against 22-year-old Tyler Robinson in the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.

items.title: Sen. Chris Coons says the internet is "driving extremism in this country"
items.standfirst: As the nation grapples with the fallout from the Charlie Kirk assassination last week, Sens. James Lankford, Republican of Oklahoma, and Chris Coons, Democrat of Delaware, join "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" to discuss how Congress can model civility. Coons warns that the idea that Kirk could be killed "in such a grotesque and public way has to bring us to reflect about how hard it's getting, because the internet is an accelerant – it is driving extremism in this country."
items.content: As the nation grapples with the fallout from the Charlie Kirk assassination last week, Sens. James Lankford, Republican of Oklahoma, and Chris Coons, Democrat of Delaware, join "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" to discuss how Congress can model civility. Coons warns that the idea that Kirk could be killed "in such a grotesque and public way has to bring us to reflect about how hard it's getting, because the internet is an accelerant – it is driving extremism in this country."

items.title: Utah Governor Blasts ‘Evil’ Social Media After Kirk Killing
items.standfirst: Utah Governor Spencer Cox blamed social-media companies for helping foment divisiveness that led to the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, calling them “conflict entrepreneurs” that profit from political polarization.
items.content: Utah Governor Spencer Cox blamed social-media companies for helping foment divisiveness that led to the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, calling them “conflict entrepreneurs” that profit from political polarization.

items.title: The latest in the case against Tyler Robinson, the suspected shooter of Charlie Kirk

items.content: We look at the latest in the case against Tyler Robinson, the young man authorities believe is responsible for the assassination of conservative youth leader Charlie Kirk last week in Utah.

Authorities are looking into the suspect's possible radicalization online.
House Speaker Mike Johnson will discuss the aftermath of the shooting on "Face the Nation".
Senators Chris Coons and James Lankford will discuss political extremism on "Face the Nation".
University of Chicago professor Robert Pape will be interviewed on "Face the Nation".

items.title: Spain’s Vuelta cycling finale abandoned after massive pro-Palestine protest
items.standfirst: Pro-Palestine demonstrators have repeatedly targeted the Israel-Premier Tech cycling team during the race in Spain.
items.content: Pro-Palestine demonstrators have repeatedly targeted the Israel-Premier Tech cycling team during the race in Spain.

items.title: Final stage of Spain's Vuelta abandoned after police clash with pro-Palestinian protesters
items.standfirst: The final stage of Spain's Vuelta cycling race was abandoned on Sunday afternoon as cyclists were entering Madrid after police clashed with pro-Palestinian protesters in the Spanish capital's centre. Police fired tear gas at the crowds as hundreds of pro-Palestinian protesters knocked down security barriers and surged onto the course.
items.content: The final stage of Spain's Vuelta cycling race was abandoned on Sunday afternoon as cyclists were entering Madrid after police clashed with pro-Palestinian protesters in the Spanish capital's centre. Police fired tear gas at the crowds as hundreds of pro-Palestinian protesters knocked down security barriers and surged onto the course.

The race was cancelled midway through due to the clashes and protests.

items.title: Marco Rubio visits Israel to push for Gaza ceasefire talks
items.standfirst: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio arrived in Israel on Sunday, as Israel intensified its attacks against northern Gaza, flattening another high-rise building and killing at least 12 Palestinians. The trip is taking place after President Donald Trump rebuked Israel over the unprecedented attack against Hamas leaders meeting in Doha on Tuesday.

The trip is taking place after President Donald Trump rebuked Israel over the unprecedented attack against Hamas leaders meeting in Doha on Tuesday.

clusters.title: Venezuela says U.S. warship raided a tuna boat as tensions rise in the Caribbean
clusters.neutral_headline: Venezuela accuses U.S. of seizing fishing boat in Caribbean

items.title: Venezuela says U.S. warship raided a tuna boat as tensions rise in the Caribbean
items.standfirst: Personnel from a U.S. warship boarded a Venezuelan tuna boat with nine fishermen while it was sailing in Venezuelan waters, Venezuela’s foreign minister said on Saturday, underlining strained relations with the United States.
items.content: Personnel from a U.S. warship boarded a Venezuelan tuna boat with nine fishermen while it was sailing in Venezuelan waters, Venezuela’s foreign minister said on Saturday, underlining strained relations with the United States.

items.title: Venezuela accuses U.S. of seizing fishing boat in Caribbean amid standoff
items.standfirst: Venezuela's foreign ministry said nine fishermen were "illegally and hostilely" detained on Friday by the USS Jason Dunham.
items.content: Venezuela's foreign ministry said nine fishermen were "illegally and hostilely" detained on Friday by the USS Jason Dunham.

items.title: Venezuela says US navy raided fishing boat amid rising tensions
items.standfirst: Personnel from a US warship boarded a Venezuelan tuna boat with nine fishermen while it was sailing in Venezuelan waters, Venezuela’s foreign minister said on Saturday, underlining strained relations with the United States. Tensions between the two nations escalated after US President Donald Trump in August ordered the deployment of warships in the Caribbean, off the coast of the South American country, citing the fight against Latin American drug cartels.
items.content: Personnel from a US warship boarded a Venezuelan tuna boat with nine fishermen while it was sailing in Venezuelan waters, Venezuela’s foreign minister said on Saturday, underlining strained relations with the United States. Tensions between the two nations escalated after US President Donald Trump in August ordered the deployment of warships in the Caribbean, off the coast of the South American country, citing the fight against Latin American drug cartels.

ai_summary: Venezuela says a U.S. warship raided a Venezuelan tuna boat.
The incident occurred in Venezuelan waters, according to Venezuela.
Nine Venezuelan fishermen were detained by the U.S. warship.
Tensions between the two nations have escalated recently.
The U.S. deployed warships in the Caribbean in August.

items.title: Ukrainian drone strike sparks fire at one of Russia’s top oil refineries
items.standfirst: The overnight strike on the Kirishi refinery, in Russia's northwestern Leningrad region, follows weeks of Ukrainian attacks on Russian oil infrastructure that Kyiv says fuels Moscow’s war effort.
items.content: The overnight strike on the Kirishi refinery, in Russia's northwestern Leningrad region, follows weeks of Ukrainian attacks on Russian oil infrastructure that Kyiv says fuels Moscow’s war effort.

items.content: Ukrainian drones struck an oil refinery in northwest Russia on Saturday night.

items.title: Ukraine targets key Russian oil refinery as Moscow tests hypersonic missile
items.standfirst: Ukraine says it will continue targeting Russian infrastructure delivering troops, fuel and ammunition to front lines.
items.content: Ukraine says it will continue targeting Russian infrastructure delivering troops, fuel and ammunition to front lines.

items.title: Ukraine intensifies drone strikes on Russian oil facilities, officials say
items.standfirst: Ukrainian drones on Sunday attacked the Kirishi oil refinery in the northwest Leningrad region, an official said, adding that debris from the shot-down drones caused a temporary fire. The refinery is one of Russia’s largest and is the second to be targeted in less than 48 hours.
items.content: Ukrainian drones on Sunday attacked the Kirishi oil refinery in the northwest Leningrad region, an official said, adding that debris from the shot-down drones caused a temporary fire. The refinery is one of Russia’s largest and is the second to be targeted in less than 48 hours.

ai_summary: Ukrainian drones struck a major oil refinery in Russia's Leningrad region.
The strike caused a fire at the Kirishi refinery.
The refinery is one of Russia's largest oil processing facilities.
The attack follows weeks of Ukrainian attacks on Russian oil infrastructure.
Ukraine says it will continue targeting Russian infrastructure.

clusters.title: Trump calls on NATO members to stop purchasing Russian oil
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump calls on NATO to stop buying Russian oil

items.title: Trump calls on NATO members to stop purchasing Russian oil
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Saturday he believes the Russia-Ukraine war would end if all NATO countries stopped buying oil from Russia and placed tariffs on China of 50 percent to 100 percent for its purchases of Russian petroleum. Since 2023, NATO member Turkey has been the third largest buyer of Russian oil, after China and India.
items.content: President Donald Trump said Saturday he believes the Russia-Ukraine war would end if all NATO countries stopped buying oil from Russia and placed tariffs on China of 50 percent to 100 percent for its purchases of Russian petroleum. Since 2023, NATO member Turkey has been the third largest buyer of Russian oil, after China and India.

items.title: Trump calls on NATO countries to stop buying Russian oil to end Ukraine war
items.standfirst: President Trump said that NATO's commitment to winning the war in Ukraine "has been far less than 100%."
items.content: President Trump said that NATO's commitment to winning the war in Ukraine "has been far less than 100%."

items.title: Trump urges NATO countries to stop 'shocking' Russian oil purchases
items.standfirst: The war in Ukraine would end if all NATO countries stopped buying oil from Russia, Donald Trump has said.
items.content: The war in Ukraine would end if all NATO countries stopped buying oil from Russia, Donald Trump has said.

ai_summary: Donald Trump wants NATO countries to stop buying Russian oil.
Trump believes this would end the war in Ukraine.
He also suggested tariffs on China for Russian petroleum purchases.
Turkey is the third-largest buyer of Russian oil among NATO members.
Trump said NATO's commitment to winning the war is less than 100%.

items.title: Fed governor Lisa Cook declared key property as ‘vacation home’, files show
items.standfirst: Document appears to undermine claim from Donald Trump allies that Cook committed mortgage fraudA loan estimate for an Atlanta home purchased by Lisa Cook, the Federal Reserve governor accused of mortgage fraud by the Trump administration, shows that Cook had declared the property as a “vacation home”, according to a document reviewed by Reuters.The document, dated 28 May 2021, was issued to Cook by her credit union in the weeks before she completed the purchase and shows that she had told the lender that the Atlanta property would not be her primary residence. The document appears to counter other documentation that Cook’s critics have cited in support of their claims that she committed mortgage fraud by reporting two different homes as her primary residence, two independent real-estate experts said. Continue reading...
items.content: Document appears to undermine claim from Donald Trump allies that Cook committed mortgage fraudA loan estimate for an Atlanta home purchased by Lisa Cook, the Federal Reserve governor accused of mortgage fraud by the Trump administration, shows that Cook had declared the property as a “vacation home”, according to a document reviewed by Reuters.The document, dated 28 May 2021, was issued to Cook by her credit union in the weeks before she completed the purchase and shows that she had told the lender that the Atlanta property would not be her primary residence. The document appears to counter other documentation that Cook’s critics have cited in support of their claims that she committed mortgage fraud by reporting two different homes as her primary residence, two independent real-estate experts said. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Trump administration is trying to remove Lisa Cook from the Federal Reserve.
This push comes before a crucial vote on interest rates.
Documents appear to undermine claims of mortgage fraud against Cook.
Cook declared a property as a "vacation home," according to a document.
The Trump administration is seeking an emergency ruling from a court.

clusters.title: Tens of thousands join Ankara protest against legal crackdown on Turkey's main opposition party
clusters.neutral_headline: Thousands Protest Legal Crackdown on Turkish Opposition

items.title: Tens of thousands join Ankara protest against legal crackdown on Turkey's main opposition party
items.standfirst: At least 50,000 people rallied in Ankara's vast Tandogan Square Sunday to protest against a year-long legal crackdown on members of Turkey's main opposition party, organisers said. The protest comes ahead of a court decision Monday that could invalidate the 2023 Republican People's Party congress, fundamentally reshaping the party.
items.content: At least 50,000 people rallied in Ankara's vast Tandogan Square Sunday to protest against a year-long legal crackdown on members of Turkey's main opposition party, organisers said. The protest comes ahead of a court decision Monday that could invalidate the 2023 Republican People's Party congress, fundamentally reshaping the party.

items.title: Tens of thousands protest in Ankara against legal crackdown on Turkish opposition
items.standfirst: Court case that could oust opposition leader follows detentions of more than 500 people including 17 mayors over past yearTens of thousands of people have protested in the Turkish capital, Ankara, against a court case that could oust the head of the main opposition on Monday after a year-long legal crackdown on hundreds of its members.Live footage showed crowds chanting for President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan’s resignation while waving Turkish flags and party banners. Continue reading...
items.content: Court case that could oust opposition leader follows detentions of more than 500 people including 17 mayors over past yearTens of thousands of people have protested in the Turkish capital, Ankara, against a court case that could oust the head of the main opposition on Monday after a year-long legal crackdown on hundreds of its members.Live footage showed crowds chanting for President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan’s resignation while waving Turkish flags and party banners. Continue reading...

The legal crackdown has targeted hundreds of opposition members over the past year.
